remarks: The supremum function distributes over multiplication, in the sense that ` A x. ( sup B ) = sup ( A x. B ) ` , where ` A x. B ` is shorthand for ` { A x. b | b e. B } ` and is defined as ` C ` below.  This is the simple version, with only one set argument; see ~ supmul for the more general case with two set arguments.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Jul-2013.)
statement:
supmul1.1 $e |- C = { z | E. v e. B z = ( A x. v ) } $.
supmul1.2 $e |- ( ph <-> ( ( A e. RR /\ 0 <_ A /\ A. x e. B 0 <_ x ) /\ ( B C_ RR /\ B =/= (/) /\ E. x e. RR A. y e. B y <_ x ) ) ) $.
supmul1 $p |- ( ph -> ( A x. sup ( B , RR , < ) ) = sup ( C , RR , < ) ) $.
$d A v x z $.
$d B v x y z $.
$d C x $.
